result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott J. Ramig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott J. Ramig is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott J. Ramig was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay fine of $250  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.   
*  Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
May not have contact with Lisa Ramig without consent of the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott J. Ramig

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:39pm-  Matter heard with 14CF354.  Victim rights compliance.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions - consecutive to 14CF354.  Court orders $250.00 fine plus costs, DV surcharge & DNA surcharge.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.

Defendant Scott J. Ramig appeared with Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: DE authorizes release of medical records and provided signed letter in court; The Court authorizes the e-mail to the Court from Sheriff Beth be placed in the file and sealed and a copy provided to ADA J. Zapf and Atty Hertz-McGrath. Atty McGrath calls witness Probation Agent E. Angel; sworn in and testified. For reasons set forth on the record, The Court adjourns the sentencing; subpoenas continued. Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
